American Civil Liberties Union has uncovered thousands of pages of government documents that show that torture was authorized at the highest levels of the Bush administration. Jameel Jaffer , Deputy Legal Director of the ACLU: Mr. Donald Rumsfeld 's claim that the abuse at Abu Ghraib was isolated and aberrational is demonstrably false. Government documents show that the methods used at Abu Ghraib were the same ones Mr. Donald Rumsfeld approved, and that the abuse of prisoners in Defense Department custody was systemic. If there's any "known known,' it"s that Donald Rumsfeld joined with other officials to orchestrate a program of torture. This effort to rewrite history is shameful. , Google co-founder Larry Page will replace Eric Schmidt and take over as Chief Executive Officer in April. Eric Schmidt , 55, who became CEO in 2001, will assume the role of Executive Chairman, focusing externally on deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relationships, government outreach and technology thought leadership, according to the official Google blog spot. Eric Schmidt would continue to act as an advisor to Page and co-founder Sergey Brin . "Page will take charge of Google s day-to-day operations as Chief Executive Officer starting April 4.
